subject: Olympic Games (2008)
Amputation
lead_paragraph: The sprinter Oscar Pistorius, a double amputee, takes his case to the Court of Arbitration for Sport on Tuesday in a bid to win the right to compete at the Beijing Olympics. Pistorius, a 21-year-old South African, is seeking to overturn a ruling by the International Association of Athletics Federations in January that barred him from racing against able-bodied runners because it said his prosthetic blades gave him a competitive advantage. The hearing is expected to last two days.
